Name: Bronze
Action: Unwanted co-star (you can insert yourself into an opponent's performance and create as much disturbance as you like so long as you don't make any physical contact).

Name: Bronze
Action: Skip to the tile of choice (On any given turn, instead of rolling the dice, you can move your pawn to any tile on the board)

Name: Bronze
Action: Targeted customization (you can design a customized card for a specific player and assign it to them the next time they play.)

Name: Bronze
Action: The Heckler (During an opponents turn, you can make as much noise as you'd like without moving.)

Name: Bronze
Action: Hangman (you can demand the performer tell you the number of letters in their character prompt before they being their performance)

Name: Bronze
Action: Assign a prop (pick a portable object of your choice for your opponent to integrate into their performance)

Name: Bronze
Action: Wanted co-star (pick someone to perform with you to enhance your performance, telling them just enough information for them to perform their role, but not enough for them to guess your character)

Name: Bronze
Action: Second guess (after everyone has submitted their guess, the performer must tell you if your guess was correct or not. If not, then you can submit another guess.)

Name: Silver
Action: Encore (after your initial performance and guesses have been read, you the performer can decide to perform again to improve your score)

Name: Silver
Action: Shield (deflect an opponent's offensive special card)

Name: Silver
Action: All play advantage (in the next all play round, take 1 minute to prep your performance for your ally before the round begins).

Name: Silver
Action: Sneak Peak (at the end of your performance and before guesses have been submitted, reveal on character trait)

Name: Silver
Action: Take that! (make an opponent's easy or medium card difficult by adding a situation, nationality or venue).

Name: Silver
Action: Double points (pick any round round, whether as a guesser or performer, and announce you will double your final tally for the round. This must be done after a performance but before guesses are revealed).

Name: Silver
Action: Blind The actor (make the performer wear a blindfold for the duration of their performance)

Name: Silver
Action: Make it easier on a hard *before or after

Name: Gold
Action: Right Back At Ya (deflect an opponent's offensive special card and make it apply to them instead)
